oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copy print of Union veteran Amos Kile and family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Amos Kile served in Co. D, 5th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA. As an elderly veteran long after the war, he is pictured with his wife Samantha and two daughters and two sons in front of hooked rugs. Family members are identified on back of photograph. This regiment of East Tennessee Unionists mustered in at Barboursville, Ky. in March 1862. The regiment fought at Stones River and Franklin but spent much of the war on occupation duty around Carthage and Chattanooga.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Kile, Amos; Kile, Hiram T.; Kile, Lester; Kile Johnson, Lilie; Kile, Belle; Kile, Easter; Kile, Samantha; Kile, Sparks
